1. ### Out-Of-Sample Time Series Forecasting
<!-- badges: start -->
[![License: GPL v3](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-GPL%20v3-blue.svg)](http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-3.0)
[![CRAN status](https://www.r-pkg.org/badges/version/OOS)](https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=OOS)
[![Lifecycle: stable](https://img.shields.io/badge/lifecycle-stable-brightgreen.svg)](https://lifecycle.r-lib.org/articles/stages.html)
[![codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/tylerJPike/OOS/branch/main/graph/badge.svg?token=AQ4PFWU3KS)](https://codecov.io/gh/tylerJPike/OOS)
[![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/tylerJPike/OOS.svg?branch=main)](https://travis-ci.org/tylerJPike/OOS)
[![CRAN RStudio mirror downloads](https://cranlogs.r-pkg.org/badges/grand-total/OOS?color=blue)](https://r-pkg.org/pkg/OOS)
<!-- badges: end -->

   The OOS package introduces a structured and automated approach to out-of-sample time series forecasting, a common, important, and subtle task. In many ways, this package is merely a wrapper for the excellent extant time series forecasting routines on CRAN - including both traditional econometric time series models and modern machine learning techniques. However, this package additionally provides a modern and comprehensive set of forecast combination techniques and forecast analysis tools.   
    
   [GitHub](https://github.com/tylerJPike/OOS), [Website](https://tylerjpike.github.io/OOS/),  [CRAN](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/OOS/index.html)

2. ### State-Dependent Empirical Analysis  
<!-- badges: start -->
[![License: GPL v3](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-GPL%20v3-blue.svg)](http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-3.0)
[![CRAN status](https://www.r-pkg.org/badges/version/sovereign)](https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=sovereign)
[![Lifecycle: stable](https://img.shields.io/badge/lifecycle-stable-brightgreen.svg)](https://lifecycle.r-lib.org/articles/stages.html)
[![codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/tylerJPike/sovereign/branch/main/graph/badge.svg?token=WXLWR6H93B)](https://codecov.io/gh/tylerJPike/sovereign)
[![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/tylerJPike/sovereign.svg?branch=main)](https://travis-ci.org/tylerJPike/sovereign) 
[![CRAN RStudio mirror downloads](https://cranlogs.r-pkg.org/badges/grand-total/sovereign?color=blue)](https://r-pkg.org/pkg/sovereign)
<!-- badges: end -->

   The sovereign package introduces a set of tools for state-dependent empirical analysis through both VAR- and local projection-based state-dependent forecasts, impulse response functions, and forecast error variance decomposition.
   
   [GitHub](https://github.com/tylerJPike/sovereign), [Website](https://tylerjpike.github.io/sovereign/), [CRAN](https://cloud.r-project.org/web/packages/sovereign/index.html)
